metadata.title: CVE-2023-3758 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition flaw was found in sssd where the GPO policy is notconsistently applied for authenticated users. This may lead to improperauthorization issues, granting or denying access to resourcesinappropriately.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3758` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libipa-hbac0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
libnss-sss - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
libpam-sss - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
libsss-certmap0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
libsss-idmap0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
libsss-nss-idmap0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
libsss-simpleifp0 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
libsss-sudo - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
libwbclient-sssd - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
python3-libipa-hbac - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
python3-libsss-nss-idmap - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
python3-sss - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-ad - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-ad-common - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-common - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-dbus - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-ipa - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-kcm - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-krb5 - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-krb5-common - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-ldap - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-proxy - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
sssd-tools - 2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sssd package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.3-3ubuntu0.13').
